column2:
Protocol not-ready error
*  The protocol was executed while Pre-defined protocol ready (X1D) is OFF.
*  The CPRTCL instruction was executed during protocol setting data writing.
*  The CPRTCL instruction was executed with abnormal protocol setting data.
column3:
*  Execute the CPRTCL instruction after Pre-defined protocol ready (X1D) turns on.
*  Set the CPU to STOP before writing protocol setting data so that the CPRTCL instruction cannot be executed during the writing.
*  Write the protocol setting data again to the Q series C24N, and then execute the CPRTCL instruction.
*  If this error persists even after rewriting, replace the module.

column2:
Protocol unregistered error
*  The protocol No. specified in control data for the CPRTCL instruction is not registered to the Q series C24N.
*  The CPRTCL instruction was executed with no protocol setting data written.
column3:
*  Check if the specified protocol No. is correct.
*  Check the Protocol registration area (buffer memory: 4091H to 4098H) to see if the specified protocol No. is registered.
*  Write the protocol setting data from GX Configurator-SC (Pre-defined protocol support function), and then execute the CPRTCL instruction.

column2:
Transmission monitoring timeout error
*  Transmission monitoring time has timed out.
   Although the transmission was retried the specified number of times, it did not succeed.
column3:
*  Check if the transmission is interrupted due to some reason such as DTR control.
*  Check if the CS signal is ON.
*  Check the cables for disconnection.

column2:
Receive wait timeout error
*  Receive wait time has timed out.
column3:
*  Check if the reception is interrupted due to some reason such as DTR control.
*  Check the cables for disconnection.
*  Check the sending device for an error.
*  Using the circuit trace function (communication data monitoring function), check if: 
  (1) Transmissions from external devices are interrupted.
  (2) Any data are missing due to a receive error.
  (3) An error exists in the data (packet) sent from the other device.

column2:
CPU response monitoring timeout error
*  CPU response monitoring time has timed out during transmission.
   Data to be sent to the device could not be acquired from the CPU within the set time.
column3:
*  Increase the Response monitoring time (timer 1) value. (Default: 5 seconds)
*  If an error has occurred in the CPU, refer to the troubleshooting section of the QCPU (Q mode) UserÅfs Manual (Maintenance and Inspection), and take corrective actions.

column2:
CPU response monitoring timeout error
*  CPU response monitoring time has timed out during reception.
   Data received from the device could not be stored into the CPU within the set time.
column3:
*  Increase the Response monitoring time (timer 1) value. (Default: 5 seconds)
*  If an error has occurred in the CPU, refer to the troubleshooting section of the QCPU (Q mode) UserÅfs Manual (Maintenance and Inspection), and take corrective actions.

column2:
Protocol cancel request error
*  A cancel request was accepted during protocol execution, and thereby the CPRTCL instruction failed.
*  The CPRTCL instruction failed because protocol setting data were written during CPRTCL instruction execution.
column3:
*  Check the cancelled protocol in the CPRTCL instruction's control data (execution count result), and eliminate the cause of the cancellation.
*  If necessary, clear the error information by error clear request (YE/YF).
*  Set the CPU to STOP before writing protocol setting data so that the CPRTCL instruction cannot be executed during the writing.

column2:
Packet size error

column3:
*  Check the data length of the packet sent from the device.
*  Divide the packet data into several parts and send them separately.

column2:
Too few digits error
*  When the protocol used for data reception includes a packet that contains a conversion variable (Variable number of data), the data (number of digits) corresponding to the conversion variable is insufficient.
column3:
*  Correct the data sent from the device.
*  If GX Configurator-SC (Pre-defined protocol support function) was used for protocol editing, check the sender's packet format to see if an incorrect value is set for the number of digits.

column2:
Invalid number of digits error

column3:
*  Correct the data sent from the device.
*  If GX Configurator-SC (Pre-defined protocol support function) was used for protocol editing, check the sender's packet format to see if an incorrect value is set for the number of digits.

column2:
Data length error
*  In the data received from the external device, the Length value does not match the data length of the conversion variable(s).
column3:
*  Check the data sent from the external device to see if:
  (1)The Length value is correct or not.
  (2)Any of the data corresponding to the conversion variable is missing or not.
*  If GX Configurator-SC (Pre-defined protocol support function) was used for protocol editing, check the senderÅfs packet format to see if an incorrect value is set for the conversion variable.

column2:
Value range error
*  When the protocol used for data reception includes a packet that contains a conversion variable, the value of the data corresponding to the conversion variable exceeds the range allowed for the Q series C24N.
column3:
*  Check the data sent from the external device.
*  If GX Configurator-SC (Pre-defined protocol support function) was used for protocol editing, check the sender's packet format to see if an incorrect value is set for the conversion size.
  (1)If it exceeds the range for word data, change the conversion size to Double word.
  (2)If it exceeds the range for double-word data, change the element to Non-conversion variable.

column2:

column3:

Overrun error
*  The Q series C24 received the next data before it completed receive processing of the previous data.
column3:
*  Decrease the data transmission rate and restart data communications.
*  Check whether a temporary stop has occurred in the station in which the Q series C24 is installed. (For the QCPU this can be checked using special register SD1005.) If a temporary stop has occurred, remove its cause.

column2:
Framing error
*  Data does not match the stop bit setting.
*  A malfunction occurred in the network because the power source of the partner station was on or off.
*  Noise occurs in the network.
*  When the multidrop was connected, data was transmitted simultaneously by multiple devices.
column3:
*  Match the Q series C24 and external device settings.
*  Clear the error information according to the ERR. clear request (YE/YF).
In addition, when communicating data with the non procedure protocol, execute the INPUT instruction, and read and discard the unnecessary data.
*  Measure the noise.
*  When connecting the multidrop, remove the interlock so that data will not be transmitted simultaneously by multiple devices.

column2:
Buffer full error
*  OS receive buffer overflowed and receive data was skipped.
column3:
*  Use DTR and DC control and perform data communications so that the buffer does not become full. (Perform RS/CS control when the modem function is used.)
*  If the Read Request signal was turned ON, execute read immediately.

column2:
CD signal control error
*  Data was received when CD signal is OFF when "CD terminal check enabled" was designated.
column3:
*  Recheck the CD signal control of the external device.(Send while the CD signal is ON.) 
*  Set "no CD terminal checking" and perform communication.

column3: *  Transmit data after line connection processing on the interface side that uses the modem function.
